Token.Abstract: Class used to manage the accounts functions used across the app. It supports multiple accounts and their associated credentials.
The current user account. This property may be nil if the user has never logged in.

Shared singleton
Adds a delegate to this user account manager.

Parameter.Name: delegate
Parameter.Abstract: The delegate to add.

Token.Abstract: Removes a delegate from this user account manager.

Parameter.Name: delegate
Parameter.Abstract: The delegate to remove.

Token.Abstract: Loads all the accounts.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: On output, the error if the return value is NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the accounts were loaded properly, NO in case of error

Token.Abstract: An NSArray of all the SFUserAccount instances for the app.
Returns all the user identities sorted by Org ID and User ID.
Create an account when necessary using the credentials provided.

Parameter.Name: credentials
Parameter.Abstract: The credentials to use.

Token.Abstract: Allows you to look up the user account associated with a given user identity.

Parameter.Name: userIdentity
Parameter.Abstract: The user identity of the user account to be looked up

Token.Abstract: Returns all accounts that have access to a particular org

Parameter.Name: orgId
Parameter.Abstract: The org to match accounts against

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of accounts that can access that org

Token.Abstract: Returns all accounts that match a particular instance URL

Parameter.Name: instanceURL
Parameter.Abstract: The host parameter of a given instance URL

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of accounts that match that instance URL

Token.Abstract: Returns all accounts that match a domain

Parameter.Name: domain
Parameter.Abstract: The domain.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of accounts that match that instance URL

Token.Abstract: Adds/Updates a user account

Parameter.Name: userAccount
Parameter.Abstract: The account to be added

Token.Abstract: Lookup a user account

Parameter.Name: credentials
Parameter.Abstract: used to up Account matching the credentials

Token.Abstract: Allows you to remove the given user account.

Parameter.Name: user
Parameter.Abstract: The user account to remove.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: Output error parameter, populated if there was an error deleting the account (likely from the filesystem operations).

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the deletion was successful, NO otherwise. Note: If no persisted account matching the user parameter is found, no action will be taken, and deletion will be reported as successful.

Token.Abstract: Clear all the accounts state (but do not change anything on the disk).
Invoke this method to apply the specified credentials to the a user whose credentials match. If no user exists, a new one is created. Fire notifications. This will post user update notification.

Parameter.Name: credentials
Parameter.Abstract: The credentials to apply

Token.Abstract: Invoke this method to apply the specified credentials to the a user whose credentials match. If no user exists, a new one is created. Fire notifications. This will post user update notification.

Parameter.Name: credentials
Parameter.Abstract: The credentials to apply

Parameter.Name: identityData
Parameter.Abstract: The identityData to apply

Token.Abstract: Invoke this method to apply the specified credentials to the a user whose credentials match. If no user exists, a new one is created. This will post user update notification.

Parameter.Name: credentials
Parameter.Abstract: The credentials to apply

Parameter.Name: identityData
Parameter.Abstract: The identityData to apply

Parameter.Name: shouldSendNotification
Parameter.Abstract: whether to post notifications.

Token.Abstract: Invoke this method to apply the specified id data to the user. This will post user update notification.

Parameter.Name: idData
Parameter.Abstract: The ID data to apply

Parameter.Name: user
Parameter.Abstract: The SFUserAccount to apply this change to.

Token.Abstract: This method will selectively update the custom attributes identity data for the user. Other identity data will not be impacted.

Parameter.Name: customAttributes
Parameter.Abstract: The new custom attributes data to update in the identity data.

Parameter.Name: user
Parameter.Abstract: The SFUserAccount to apply this change to.

Token.Abstract: This method will selectively update the custom permissions identity data for the user. Other identity data will not be impacted.

Parameter.Name: customPermissions
Parameter.Abstract: The new custom permissions data to update in the identity data.

Parameter.Name: user
Parameter.Abstract: The SFUserAccount to apply this change to.

Token.Abstract: Apply custom data to the SFUserAccount that can be accessed outside that user's sandbox. This data will be persisted between launches and should only be used for non-sensitive information. The NSDictionary should be NSCoder encodeable.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The NScoding enabled object to set

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: The key to retrieve this data for

Parameter.Name: user
Parameter.Abstract: The SFUserAccount to apply this change to.

Token.Abstract: Switches away from the current user, to a new user context.
Switches away from the current user, to the given user account.

Parameter.Name: newCurrentUser
Parameter.Abstract: The user to switch to.

Token.Abstract: Invoke this method to inform this manager that something has changed for the user.

Parameter.Name: user
Parameter.Abstract: The user

Parameter.Name: change
Parameter.Abstract: The type of change (enum type). Use SFUserAccountDataChange.

Token.Abstract: Kick off the login process for credentials that's previously configured.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: The block of code to execute when the authentication process successfully completes.

Parameter.Name: failureBlock
Parameter.Abstract: The block of code to execute when the authentication process has a fatal failure.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this call kicks off the authentication process. NO if an authentication process has already started, in which case subsequent requests are queued up to have their completion or failure blocks executed in succession.

Token.Abstract: Kick off the refresh process for the specified credentials.

Parameter.Name: credentials
Parameter.Abstract: SFOAuthCredentials to be refreshed.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: The block of code to execute when the refresh process successfully completes.

Parameter.Name: failureBlock
Parameter.Abstract: The block of code to execute when the refresh process has a fatal failure.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this call kicks off the authentication process. NO if an authentication process has already started, in which case subsequent requests are queued up to have their completion or failure blocks executed in succession.

Token.Abstract: Login using the given JWT token to exchange with the service for credentials.

Parameter.Name: jwtToken
Parameter.Abstract: The JWT token (received out of band) to exchange for credentials.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: The block of code to execute when the authentication process successfully completes.

Parameter.Name: failureBlock
Parameter.Abstract: The block of code to execute when the authentication process has a fatal failure.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this call kicks off the authentication process. NO if an authentication process has already started, in which case subsequent requests are queued up to have their completion or failure blocks executed in succession.

Token.Abstract: Forces a logout from the current account, redirecting the user to the login process. This throws out the OAuth refresh token.

Performs a logout on the specified user. Note that if the user is not the current user of the app, the specified user's authenticated state will be removed, but no other action will otherwise interrupt the current app state.

Parameter.Name: user
Parameter.Abstract: The user to log out.

Token.Abstract: Performs a logout for all users of the app, including the current user.
Dismisses the auth view controller, resetting the UI state back to its original presentation.
Handle an advanced authentication response from the external browser, continuing any in-progress adavanced authentication flow.

Parameter.Name: appUrlResponse
Parameter.Abstract: The URL response returned to the app from the external browser. @options Dictionary of name-value pairs received from open URL

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is a valid URL response from advanced authentication that should be handled, NO otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Set this block to handle presentation of the Authentication View Controller.

Set this block to handle presentation of the Authentication View Controller.

Determines whether an error is due to invalid auth credentials.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: The error to check against an invalid credentials error.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the error is due to invalid credentials, NO otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Handle an advanced authentication response from the external browser, continuing any in-progress adavanced authentication flow.

Parameter.Name: url
Parameter.Abstract: The URL response returned to the app from the external browser.

Parameter.Name: options
Parameter.Abstract: Dictionary of name-value pairs received from open URL

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is request is handled, NO otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Handle an error situation that occured in the IDP flow.

Parameter.Name: command
Parameter.Abstract: The Error URL request from the idp or SP App.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is request is handled, NO otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Handle an IDP initiated auth flow.

Parameter.Name: command
Parameter.Abstract: The URL request from the IDP APP.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is request is handled, NO otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Handle an IDP request initiated from an SP APP.

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: The request from the SP APP.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this request is handled, NO otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Handle an IDP response received from an IDP APP.

Parameter.Name: response
Parameter.Abstract: The URL response from the IDP APP.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is request is handled, NO otherwise.
